results.title: Whazzat?
results.creator_credit: Todd Delerman, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Art Pierson
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the East Indian folktale about six blind men who come upon an elephant and attempt to describe it. When each meets and touches the elephant he thinks he has encountered something different. Stresses the moral that cooperating with others can achieve more than working alone. For primary grades.

results.title: Whatever Happened to the Murray River?
results.brief_description: The film traces the history of the exploitation of the Murray River and shows the environmental consequences.

results.title: Whatever Happened to Childhood?
results.brief_description: Childhood as today’s adults knew it no longer exists. Early exposure to the pressures of drug usage and changing sexual morality, along with a new indifference to, and participation in, criminal behaviour is forcing our children into becoming adults at a younger age. Both young people and adults tell their stories and explore our changing society.

results.title: What, where and when
results.creator_credit: The Gan Council and Denis Shand
results.brief_description: Sounds hints for housewives: How to buy fish and meat, what makes a balanced meal, using the fridge and storing vegetables, cooking utensils and various hints on all matters dealing with the work of the housewife in the kitchen. No 1 of a Cookery Series suitable for women’s groups and domestic science classes.

results.title: What you ought to want
results.brief_description: Bishop G. Bromley Oxnam addresses a group of young people on the subject, “How do you tell right from wrong?” He points to the basic facets in our heritage of history and of faith which can be used to measure the effects of choices one makes. He demonstrates ways in which the best of science, history, poetry, drama and religion can be brought to bear on decisions which may touch not only one’s own personality but those of others in the family, community, nation and world.

results.title: What would happen if...? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies Series”.
First grade children sort materials, and compare wood with sawdust. Second grade children experiment with objects and are introduced to the terms interaction, sub-systems and variables. Third graders find which part of a mixture changes the colour of a BTB/vinegar solution, and experiment with changing variables.

results.title: What women want
results.creator_credit: ICON, Paramount Pictures, Wind Dancer Productions, Centropolis Effects, Susan Cartonis, Bruce Davey, Gina Matthews, Nancy Meyers and Matt Williams
results.brief_description: Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is a real ladies man. Raised by his mother, a Las Vegas showgirl, he has a somewhat distorted perception of what women really want, and an enormous ego. When he is passed over for an executive position in the advertising agency for a woman his chauvinistic attitude worsens. A freak accident while trying to brainstorm ideas for a new advertising campaign, leaves Nick with the ability to hear what women think. Amazed by his new talent Nick seeks the help of a therapist (Bette Midler) who suggests he think of it as a gift and not a curse, and to use this to his advantage. Nick sets his sights on Darcy McGuire (Helen Hunt), the new creative director in the agency. At first his plan works, and he undermines Darcy at every opportunity, until he realises Darcy has feelings for him, and that he feels the same way about her. Cast also includes Marisa Tomei, Mark Feurstein, Lauren Holly, Valerie Perrine, Delta Bourke and Alan Alda

results.title: What we do at kindergarten
results.creator_credit: Myles-Milwright Productions, Dianne Milwright, Donn Clauscen and Pamela Eagles
results.brief_description: Shows daily activities in kindergartens emphasising the extent activities aid the preschool child’s development. Suitable for use with parents of kindergarten age children and for infant primary teachers as a background knowledge of what happens in kindergartens.
